▪ WSDA overtime (OT) increases on a cyclical basis to meet industry

94% of WSDA’s OT occurs in the Commodity Inspection Division (From 1/1/07 to 6/30/07 WSDA had 36,087.6 hours of OT. 33,985.5 of those hours were in the Commodity Inspection Division.) OT in the Commodity Inspection Division is driven by industry demand. These OT costs are covered by inspection fee revenue.
94% of WSDA’s OT occurs in the Commodity Inspection Division
(From 1/1/07 to 6/30/07 WSDA had 36,087.6 hours of OT. 33,985.5
of those hours were in the Commodity Inspection Division.) OT in the
Commodity Inspection Division is driven by industry demand. These
OT costs are covered by inspection fee revenue.

Industry-driven OT is essential to support the economic vitality of the industry. It supports commerce in domestic and export markets.
